alert.note: Alert for Caledonia (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 6:31AM EST until December 19 at 11:24PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Vermont... Passumpsic River at Passumpsic affecting Caledonia County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passumpsic River at Passumpsic. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...Until the river stage falls below 14 feet, Route 5 in St. Johnsbury center will remain flooded, as well as low lying trailer homes near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 15.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 AM EST Tuesday was 16.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.2 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.3 feet on 04/21/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 645 PM EST.
